results.name: Least prime p such that sum_{k=0}^n (k+1)^2*x^{n-k} is irreducible modulo p.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) does not exceed the (4n-3)-th prime for each n>0.  Moreover, for any integers m>1 and n>0 the polynomial sum_{k=0}^n (k+1)^m*x^{n-k} is irreducible modulo some prime, and its Galois group over the rationals is isomorphic to the symmetric group S_n. Also, for m,n=2,3,... there are infinitely many integers b > n^m such that [n^m,...,2^m,1^m] in base b is prime.
We have a similar conjecture with the above (k+1)^m replaced by (2k+1)^m.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
